page.title: 19Colvend: Tourism
page.content: In the region of Dumfries and Galloway tourism is being encouraged so as to give people employment, since there is no industry and farming employs fewer people now than it did in the past. Tourists come mainly from England, Ireland or Europe though some are Scots. They usually stay for one or two nights because they are touring in the region. Those who come here do so because it is quiet and they like the scenery.The visitors tend to be older people, or families with young children who can play on the beaches. Some people take visitors for "bed and breakfast",but in our area about one third of the houses are let for holidays,which means that in winter many houses lie empty.
